metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: スノボ男子HP予選 戸塚2位 平野歩夢7位 日本勢全員決勝へ
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード男子ハーフパイプの予選が行われ、日本勢は出場した4人全員が決勝に進出しました。前回大会の金メダリストで骨折の影響が心配される平野歩夢選手は7位での予選突破です。

all.headline: 中道 あす代表選挙 小川淳也氏と階猛氏が立候補の意向を示す
all.description: 中道改革連合は野田・斉藤両共同代表の後任を選ぶ代表選挙を13日に行うことになりました。代表選挙には、小川淳也氏と階猛氏の2人の立憲民主党出身者が立候補する意向を示しました。

all.headline: 日本人の妊婦 妊娠前の体重少ないと 赤ちゃん低体重リスク高く
all.description: 日本人の妊婦76万人分のデータを分析したところ、妊娠前の体重が標準より少ないと低体重の赤ちゃんが産まれるリスクが1.6倍高くなっていたとする研究結果を、国立成育医療研究センターなどのグループがまとめました。

all.headline: 政府 “ナミビアのレアアース 日本企業による権益確保検討へ”
all.description: 電気自動車などに欠かせない希少な金属・レアアースの安定的な確保につなげようと、日本政府は各国との協議を本格化させています。このうち南西アフリカのナミビアとは現地の鉱山にまとまった量のレアアースがあることが日本の探査で確認され、今後、日本企業による権益の確保に向けて、具体的な検討を進めていくことになりました。

all.headline: キーウに暖取るテント200か所設置 エネルギー関連施設攻撃受け
all.description: ウクライナでロシア軍の攻撃による長時間の計画停電が続く中、首都キーウには暖房などを提供するテントがおよそ200か所設置され、市民が厳しい寒さをしのいでいます。

all.headline: セブン-イレブン 北海道でおにぎりなどの製造 一日3回を2回に
all.description: 食品の製造現場の人手不足に対応するため、大手コンビニが、これまで一日3回だった、おにぎりやサンドイッチなどの製造・出荷を一日2回に減らす取り組みを始めました。物流の効率化も検討することにしています。

all.headline: バングラデシュ 政変後初の総選挙 汚職撲滅や雇用対策など争点
all.description: おととし、学生らによる抗議デモで強権的な政権が崩壊したバングラデシュで、12日、政変後初めての総選挙が行われます。前の政権下の最大野党が優勢と伝えられる一方、デモを主導した学生らが立ち上げた新党は伸び悩んでいて選挙結果が注目されます。

all.headline: ‘Sai: Disaster’: Evil has no clear shape or meaning
all.description: Directed by Yutaro Seki and Kentaro Hirase, the chilling thriller centered on a shapeshifting killer is more interested in mood than motive.

all.headline: Heartbreak for Japan's Tomitaka as tiebreaker keeps her off Olympic moguls podium
all.description: Tomitaka scored 78.00 points in her final run on Wednesday at the Olympics, dead even with France’s Perrine Laffont, but lost a tiebreaker due to a lower turn score.

all.headline: Swiss will vote on 10 million population cap proposal in June
all.description: The proposal is going to a national vote after supporters gathered enough signatures under Switzerland’s direct democracy system.

all.headline: U.K.'s crumbling canals threatened with collapse
all.description: The sight starkly illustrated an ongoing battle to maintain the U.K.'s historic, yet deteriorating, waterways.

all.headline: With XO sauce, a Nagasaki shrimp toast turns into a slice of heaven
all.description: This Japanese version of a Cantonese favorite is all you need for an indulgent afternoon treat.

all.headline: Toyota Chairman Akio Toyoda to be inducted into U.S. Auto Hall of Fame
all.description: Toyoda will be the fourth member of the company's founding Toyoda family to receive the honor. Other Japanese inductees include Soichiro Honda, the founder of Honda.

all.headline: CRA soul-searching begins with vote to elect new leader
all.description: After its disastrous defeat on Sunday, the fledgling Centrist Reform Alliance is hoping a new face at the top will help it find its bearings.

all.headline: U.S. moves to counter China in Bangladesh, plans to pitch defense alternatives
all.description: China recently signed a defense agreement ​with Bangladesh to build a drone factory near the India border, worrying foreign diplomats.

all.headline: Challenges for Japan during the U.S.-China ‘truce’
all.description: Leaders in Beijing — and some in Washington — have a shared vision of U.S.-China co-leadership of the global order.

all.headline: Cambodia says it has closed almost 200 scam centers in fraud crackdown
all.description: Thousands of scam workers, ​some of them trafficking victims confined in ⁠brutal conditions, have fled compounds in recent weeks seeking to return home.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Kokomo Murase Comes Out on Top After Overcoming Obstacles, Aiming for Greater Heights in Competition
all.description: Kokomo Murase delivered a stunning performance on the Olympic stage, bringing Japan its first Olympic gold in a women’s snowboard event on Monday.

all.headline: Japanese Constitutional Revision Debate Expected to be Revived After LDP Secures Lower House Majority
all.description: Diet debates on Constitutional revision are likely to begin after the Liberal Democratic Party gained 316 seats in the House of Representatives election, exceeding the two-thirds in the lower house an

all.headline: Prime Minister Takaichi Drives Ahead With Priority Policies, Promotes Discussion of Consumption Tax Cuts
all.description: Following the ruling Liberal Democratic Party’s historic victory in the House of Representatives election on Sunday, Prime Minister and LDP President Sanae Takaichi is moving ahead at full steam to re

Fuju Kamio, Former Idol Group Member Yurina Hirate Announce Marriage
2 CRA Lawmakers Announced Leadership Run; Former Komeito Members Won’t Run to Be New Leader
Ice Sculptures Illuminated in Rainbow Color at Hokkaido Festival
all.description: KAMIKAWA, Hokkaido — The annual Sounkyo Onsen Ice Fall Festival has started in Kamikawa, Hokkaido, with ice sculptures illuminated in rainbow colors, creating fantastical scenery.

all.headline: Memorial Hall for 2025 Osaka-Kansai Expo Planned to Be Built on Yumeshima Artificial Island Where Intl Event Took Place
all.description: OSAKA — A memorial hall will be built at the site of the 2025 Osaka-Kansai Expo in Konohana Ward, Osaka, as part of efforts to pass down the legacy of the Expo to future generations, according to sour

all.headline: Korean Air to Increase Niigata-Seoul Flights to Daily Service Starting on June 1
all.description: Korean Air announced Tuesday that it will increase direct flights between Niigata and Seoul from three flights per week to daily service starting on June 1.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan Narrowly Takes Bronze in Ski Jumping Mixed Team Event; Nikaido’s High Score Proves Decider
all.description: Japan took bronze in the ski jumping mixed team event at the Milano Cortina Winter Games on Tuesday local time.

Thai police arrest gunman after two injured in school siege
all.description: The suspect has been detained and all hostages freed after a two-hour standoff at a school in southern Thailand, police said.

all.headline: Australia's opposition leader under pressure after key resignation
all.description: The resignation of a key colleague paves the way for a challenge to first female Liberal leader Sussan Ley.

all.headline: India orders social media firms to remove unlawful content within three hours
all.description: Critics worry the rules would be a compliance challenge for tech platforms and could expand censorship.

all.headline: 'We are treated as outcasts': Acid attack survivor fights for justice and dignity
all.description: Malik recently petitioned India's top court to include survivors forced to ingest acid under disability law.

all.headline: Emergency call released of boy who swam for hours to save family
all.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, swam to get help for his mother and siblings after they were swept out to sea.

all.headline: Indonesia preparing to deploy up to 8,000 soldiers to Gaza
all.description: It would be the first country to do so as part of phase two of the ceasefire agreement brokered by the US last year.

all.headline: Japan has given Takaichi a landslide win - but can she bring back the economy?
all.description: Japan has been battling sluggish growth, mounting public debt and a rapidly ageing workforce.

all.headline: Australian author's erotic novel is child sex abuse material, judge finds
all.description: The author's erotic novel featured an 18-year-old protagonist who role-played as a toddler.

all.headline: Philippine top court says same-sex couples can co-own property
all.description: The landmark decision said "legitimate intimate relationships" must not be "legally invisible".

all.headline: Twenty years is 'a death sentence', son of British media tycoon jailed by China says
all.description: A Hong Kong court sentences the 78-year-old British citizen Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after he was found guilty of national security offences last December.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

competitors.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
competitors.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

competitors.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

competitors.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
competitors.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

competitors.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
competitors.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

competitors.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
competitors.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

competitors.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
competitors.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

primary.headline: スノボ男子HP予選 戸塚2位 平野歩夢7位 日本勢全員決勝へ
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード男子ハーフパイプの予選が行われ、日本勢は出場した4人全員が決勝に進出しました。前回大会の金メダリストで骨折の影響が心配される平野歩夢選手は7位での予選突破です。

primary.headline: 中道 あす代表選挙 小川淳也氏と階猛氏が立候補の意向を示す
primary.description: 中道改革連合は野田・斉藤両共同代表の後任を選ぶ代表選挙を13日に行うことになりました。代表選挙には、小川淳也氏と階猛氏の2人の立憲民主党出身者が立候補する意向を示しました。

primary.headline: 日本人の妊婦 妊娠前の体重少ないと 赤ちゃん低体重リスク高く
primary.description: 日本人の妊婦76万人分のデータを分析したところ、妊娠前の体重が標準より少ないと低体重の赤ちゃんが産まれるリスクが1.6倍高くなっていたとする研究結果を、国立成育医療研究センターなどのグループがまとめました。

primary.headline: 政府 “ナミビアのレアアース 日本企業による権益確保検討へ”
primary.description: 電気自動車などに欠かせない希少な金属・レアアースの安定的な確保につなげようと、日本政府は各国との協議を本格化させています。このうち南西アフリカのナミビアとは現地の鉱山にまとまった量のレアアースがあることが日本の探査で確認され、今後、日本企業による権益の確保に向けて、具体的な検討を進めていくことになりました。

primary.headline: キーウに暖取るテント200か所設置 エネルギー関連施設攻撃受け
primary.description: ウクライナでロシア軍の攻撃による長時間の計画停電が続く中、首都キーウには暖房などを提供するテントがおよそ200か所設置され、市民が厳しい寒さをしのいでいます。

primary.headline: セブン-イレブン 北海道でおにぎりなどの製造 一日3回を2回に
primary.description: 食品の製造現場の人手不足に対応するため、大手コンビニが、これまで一日3回だった、おにぎりやサンドイッチなどの製造・出荷を一日2回に減らす取り組みを始めました。物流の効率化も検討することにしています。

primary.headline: バングラデシュ 政変後初の総選挙 汚職撲滅や雇用対策など争点
primary.description: おととし、学生らによる抗議デモで強権的な政権が崩壊したバングラデシュで、12日、政変後初めての総選挙が行われます。前の政権下の最大野党が優勢と伝えられる一方、デモを主導した学生らが立ち上げた新党は伸び悩んでいて選挙結果が注目されます。

primary.headline: ‘Sai: Disaster’: Evil has no clear shape or meaning
primary.description: Directed by Yutaro Seki and Kentaro Hirase, the chilling thriller centered on a shapeshifting killer is more interested in mood than motive.

primary.headline: Heartbreak for Japan's Tomitaka as tiebreaker keeps her off Olympic moguls podium
primary.description: Tomitaka scored 78.00 points in her final run on Wednesday at the Olympics, dead even with France’s Perrine Laffont, but lost a tiebreaker due to a lower turn score.

primary.headline: Swiss will vote on 10 million population cap proposal in June
primary.description: The proposal is going to a national vote after supporters gathered enough signatures under Switzerland’s direct democracy system.

primary.headline: U.K.'s crumbling canals threatened with collapse
primary.description: The sight starkly illustrated an ongoing battle to maintain the U.K.'s historic, yet deteriorating, waterways.

primary.headline: With XO sauce, a Nagasaki shrimp toast turns into a slice of heaven
primary.description: This Japanese version of a Cantonese favorite is all you need for an indulgent afternoon treat.

primary.headline: Toyota Chairman Akio Toyoda to be inducted into U.S. Auto Hall of Fame
primary.description: Toyoda will be the fourth member of the company's founding Toyoda family to receive the honor. Other Japanese inductees include Soichiro Honda, the founder of Honda.

primary.headline: CRA soul-searching begins with vote to elect new leader
primary.description: After its disastrous defeat on Sunday, the fledgling Centrist Reform Alliance is hoping a new face at the top will help it find its bearings.

primary.headline: U.S. moves to counter China in Bangladesh, plans to pitch defense alternatives
primary.description: China recently signed a defense agreement ​with Bangladesh to build a drone factory near the India border, worrying foreign diplomats.

primary.headline: Challenges for Japan during the U.S.-China ‘truce’
primary.description: Leaders in Beijing — and some in Washington — have a shared vision of U.S.-China co-leadership of the global order.

primary.headline: Cambodia says it has closed almost 200 scam centers in fraud crackdown
primary.description: Thousands of scam workers, ​some of them trafficking victims confined in ⁠brutal conditions, have fled compounds in recent weeks seeking to return home.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Kokomo Murase Comes Out on Top After Overcoming Obstacles, Aiming for Greater Heights in Competition
primary.description: Kokomo Murase delivered a stunning performance on the Olympic stage, bringing Japan its first Olympic gold in a women’s snowboard event on Monday.

primary.headline: Japanese Constitutional Revision Debate Expected to be Revived After LDP Secures Lower House Majority
primary.description: Diet debates on Constitutional revision are likely to begin after the Liberal Democratic Party gained 316 seats in the House of Representatives election, exceeding the two-thirds in the lower house an

primary.headline: Prime Minister Takaichi Drives Ahead With Priority Policies, Promotes Discussion of Consumption Tax Cuts
primary.description: Following the ruling Liberal Democratic Party’s historic victory in the House of Representatives election on Sunday, Prime Minister and LDP President Sanae Takaichi is moving ahead at full steam to re

Ice Sculptures Illuminated in Rainbow Color at Hokkaido Festival
primary.description: KAMIKAWA, Hokkaido — The annual Sounkyo Onsen Ice Fall Festival has started in Kamikawa, Hokkaido, with ice sculptures illuminated in rainbow colors, creating fantastical scenery.

primary.headline: Memorial Hall for 2025 Osaka-Kansai Expo Planned to Be Built on Yumeshima Artificial Island Where Intl Event Took Place
primary.description: OSAKA — A memorial hall will be built at the site of the 2025 Osaka-Kansai Expo in Konohana Ward, Osaka, as part of efforts to pass down the legacy of the Expo to future generations, according to sour

primary.headline: Korean Air to Increase Niigata-Seoul Flights to Daily Service Starting on June 1
primary.description: Korean Air announced Tuesday that it will increase direct flights between Niigata and Seoul from three flights per week to daily service starting on June 1.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan Narrowly Takes Bronze in Ski Jumping Mixed Team Event; Nikaido’s High Score Proves Decider
primary.description: Japan took bronze in the ski jumping mixed team event at the Milano Cortina Winter Games on Tuesday local time.

secondary.description: The resignation of a key colleague paves the way for a challenge to first female Liberal leader Sussan Ley.

secondary.headline: India orders social media firms to remove unlawful content within three hours
secondary.description: Critics worry the rules would be a compliance challenge for tech platforms and could expand censorship.

secondary.headline: 'We are treated as outcasts': Acid attack survivor fights for justice and dignity
secondary.description: Malik recently petitioned India's top court to include survivors forced to ingest acid under disability law.

secondary.headline: Emergency call released of boy who swam for hours to save family
secondary.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, swam to get help for his mother and siblings after they were swept out to sea.

secondary.description: It would be the first country to do so as part of phase two of the ceasefire agreement brokered by the US last year.

secondary.description: Japan has been battling sluggish growth, mounting public debt and a rapidly ageing workforce.

secondary.description: The author's erotic novel featured an 18-year-old protagonist who role-played as a toddler.

secondary.description: The landmark decision said "legitimate intimate relationships" must not be "legally invisible".

secondary.headline: Twenty years is 'a death sentence', son of British media tycoon jailed by China says
secondary.description: A Hong Kong court sentences the 78-year-old British citizen Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after he was found guilty of national security offences last December.

screenshots.name: Takaichi Sanae
tweets:
Congratulations to the mixed ski jumping team for winning the bronze medal at the Milan-Cortina Olympics!

Nozomi Maruyama and Ren Nikaido are riding high after already winning medals at this tournament, and Sara Takanashi and Ryosuke Kobayashi have always led Japanese ski jumping at the forefront of the world.

Chairman Mezzola, I would like to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your warm congratulations.
I look forward to continued cooperation to further strengthen the good relationship between Japan and the EU.


@EP_President
 Metsola, I sincerely appreciate your kind words of congratulations. I look forward to continuing to work

Congratulations to Prime Minister @takaichi_sanae on the election result in the House of Representatives.

A strong EU-Japan partnership and continued collaboration are key to global economic stability

Chairman von der Leyen, I would like to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your warm words of congratulations.
We look forward to continuing to work together to further deepen our strategic partnership, from security and defense to competitiveness and economic security.

President
@vonderleyen
, I sincerely appreciate your kind words

Warm congratulations to Prime Minister @takaichi_sanae on her landmark victory in today’s  elections.

Looking forward to renewed impetus to deepen the EU–Japan strategic partnership across the board.

From competitiveness and innovation to cooperation on economic security and
